option.name: manualTemplate
option.value:
# GUIDELINES: Writing useful git messages can ensure that your # git commits remain useful and keep your team members happy, in the # know and easily explain the changes you are making. # # Subject: # - Use the imperative mood (imagine the words "This will") # - Capitalize the first letter # - Limit to 50 characters # - Do not end the subject line with a period # # .................. 50 CHARS .................. # Summarize the change in less than 50 characters
# Body: # Explain exactly what was done in this commit with more depth than # the 50 character subject line. Remember to wrap at 70 characters! # - Add line breaks so each line is a maximum of 72 characters # - Explain the thinking / reasons behind the commit # - Use the body to explain what and why vs. how # - May be left empty # # ............................ 70 CHARS ............................ #
# Ticket ID: # The JIRA TIcket ID that this commit closes or relates too. # Ticket ID: SS-XXX
# Footer: # Include any additional notes, relevant links, or co-authors. # - May be left empty # Co-Author: FirstName LastName <email@address.com>
